Located in the Humber River watershed in North Etobicoke, the Arb offers one hundred hectares of public gardens and natural areas to explore, with programming based out of the Centre for Urban Ecology.

The Humber Arboretum exists as a unique tri-partnership between Humber Polytechnic, the City of Toronto, and the Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA).

Opened in 1977, when atmospheric C02 was approximately 333.73 PPM

note: 🇪🇨, she/her, 🧠 #2e #academicMom of a 2e child  🏔🌴🍀🌿🌾 lover, Ecuadorian useful plants, taxonomist and ecologist (Páramo), long-term vegetation & climate monitoring, #IAmABotanist #WomeninSTEM, #fedi22 #Ecuador #Fibromyalgia

Bigger than any known bacterium・Views informed by trillions of microbes

I got my PhD in Dianne Newman's lab at Caltech, where I teased apart the genetic mechanisms behind a new metabolic process in a bacterium I isolated from soil. This work was supported by an NSF GRFP fellowship. For my postdoc, I'm working with Ellen Yeh at Stanford to develop the microalga Botryooccus braunii into a model system for studying plant lipid secretion.
